text:
From gracing the cover of Vanity Fair to the endless amount of social media PDA, Jennifer Lopez and Alex Rodriguez are the ultimate #couplegoals!

RELATED: 8 Heartwarming Things Jennifer Lopez & Alex Rodriguez Have Said About Each Other

There's no question that the power couple is falling for each other. The two lovebirds are no strangers to flaunting their love off to the public, hence why J.Lo just released a new single called "Amor Amor Amor," featuring Reggaeton artist Wisin. The track has a tropical pop vibe to as the Puerto Rican beauty sings in Spanish, "When we make love, love, love, I come to life."

Though this isn't the first time 47-year-old star professes her love to a mate, this dedication reflects the steamy romance the couple share. The lyrics scream sexy, passion, and pure admiration she has for boyfriend ARod. It's clear Lopez feels brand new when she's with the former Yankee player and everyone can't get enough of it.

MORE: Jennifer Lopez & Alex Rodriguez: Their Road to Love

During an interview with HOLA! USA, the mother-of-two said, "It’s about how we are always kind of reinventing ourselves, experiencing things for the first time, no matter how old you are." Embracing her Bronx roots, Jenni from the Block showed off her dance moves alongside some World of Dance partners including Eva Igo, Diana Pombo, The Lab, Ian Eastwood and Power Peralta twins in an NYC subway station. Check out the video is below.
title: Jennifer Lopez's New Track ‘Amor Amor Amor’ Proves She & A.Rod Have A Steamy Romance
